Package chess

Class ChessBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.ChessBoard

  • public class ChessBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of chessboard. Contains all logic for getting/setting positions, making copies of the board, and returning current board layout.
    Author:
    alh220, jmuccino

    • Method Detail

      • initializeBoard

        protected void initializeBoard​()
        Initializes the chessboard to the standard starting position

      • getBoard

        protected java.lang.String getBoard​()
        Draws out the board based on where pieces currently are. If no piece is on the square, prints "##" for brown or empty spaces " " for white. Also prints out rank and file.
        Returns:
        a string representation of the chessboard

      • getPiece

        protected Piece getPiece​(int row,
                         int col)
        Returns which piece is on the square.
        Parameters:
        row - an integer representing an index in the array for rank.
        col - an integer representing an index in the array for file.
        Returns:
        a Piece object that is on the square

      • setPiece

        protected void setPiece​(int row,
                        int col,
                        Piece piece)
        Sets the piece given on the square indicated
        Parameters:
        row - an integer representing an index in the array for rank
        col - an integer representing an index in the array for file
        piece - a Piece object to put onto the square

      • makeCopy

        protected ChessBoard makeCopy​()
        Makes a copy of this board and returns that copy.
        Returns:
        a new instance of ChessBoard.
